title: junglers impact on toplane and ganking times.
body: ok so I'm a top lane main that's rather playing off meta picks or sticking to meta builds blah blah. top lane is the only lane that is 1 sided and is decided by their jgler. if the jgler wants top to win its all up to him to cement this no matter the match up. but I feel junglers don't know WHEN to gank. like if there is 2 or more waves at your toplaner's tower, don't force him to miss all that XP as well as pure gold for 1 kill that ends with them TP-íng back and your top laner is actually even more behind. as a top laner I know the feels here and I'm over getting the wrong ganks and if I ping them back to let them know its not worth yet, BOOM I'm solo for the rest of the game and I'm 1 v 2 and sometimes even 1 v 3 and its all over. this account is only silver but ill be out of here soon just want to have a little squirt over the low elo junglers

replies.body:
i disagree, if the enemy toplane is straight up tping back in that situation it's an easy kill and another summoner spell.

 In games where my laners haven't been massively crushed in the first few minutes and they're whining that I have to repair their lane or they'll dc (realistically I'd like to help lanes that can do something with a lead but low elo has the mentality that junglers have to fix lanes and so I'm busy babystitting and being careful not to 'ks' when I'm playing a bloody assassin who should have better things to do), I've found great success with ganking a lane, burning their flash and then pinging to disengage rather than waste summs, hp, and lose cs, going back, putting down some wards or taking stock of the enemy jungler position, taking gromp, wrapping around again, for a repeat gank, getting a kill, waiting for the laner to tp back, and then wrapping around again for another kill or at least forcing a back. A 2 level lead, no enemy summs, 1.5 waves of minions, or I could leave you there, lets you try your best to get the best of 2 waves under pressure, and risk letting them dive you or simply just zone you out of the crashing cs and completely wreck your tower.

The issue is people have the mentality that ganking is for killing, but forcing a back, burning summoners, zoning are all very important too. If your jungler is doing a gank like that, odds are it isn't a 'kill gank', but more to try to alleviate pressure, even out the hp/mana levels on the lane and let you setup a freeze, and then he plans on recalling and buying. Those types of gank should be responded to with zone pressure, you need to move up, maybe throw a few spells in until the enemy laner disengages, don't chase, once the enemy laner has gotten some distance, return to your minions, you'll miss a few yes, but unless you're high elo, you're going to lose minions to the crashing tower if your opponent is pressuring you anyway, and you may even die for it, or take a chunk of damage onto your tower. If you're under tower with half hp, enemy is crashing a wave to tower, and your jungler comes in, he's not trying to kill the laner, he's likely aiming to alleviate pressure, or at least trade some of his hp into your laners before he recalls.

I hate people who ragequit when you 'ks' during a gank. Makes me unnecessarily paranoid about taking kills, when I'm playing bloody shaco. Yeah sure if I'm playing sej or something, I don't need the kills, but assassins really do need the extra gold to snowball.

Assist gold isn't pittance anymore, and hasn't been for ages. Better to get a kill on the jungler and assist on top than no kill at all.
